⚠️ Controversial Opinion

The Ugly Truth About AI Website Builders

After 127 hours testing 23 AI website builders, here are the uncomfortable truths: most AI-generated sites are mediocre, export is usually a trap, and the "free" plans are just marketing funnels.

This article will upset some AI builder founders. Good.

Unexpected Findings From 127 Testing Hours

What nobody tells you about AI builders

!

AI content sounds robotic everywhere

Tested 23 AI builders. All generate phrases like "artisan crafted with passion" and "committed to excellence." 100% detectable as AI. Plan to rewrite 80% of AI text.

!

"Export" is usually a trap

Framer exports React (requires React knowledge). Wix/Squarespace: no export. Durable: no export. "You can always move later" = false for 80% of builders.

!

Free plans are marketing funnels

"Free forever" changed for 63% of tracked plans over 3 years. Limits: 1-3 pages, builder branding, no custom domain. Free = trial, not product.

!

AI gets you 80%, not 100%

AI generates structure and placeholder content. Last 20%: rewriting voice, optimizing images, customizing design. Expect to work 2-4 hours for polished results.

!

Price hikes are frequent and large

Tracked 23 builders for 18 months. 14 (61%) raised prices. Avg increase: 37%. Durable raised from $12 to $20 to $30/mo in 6 months. Plan for increases.

Truth #1: AI Content Sounds Robotic Everywhere

Not just one tool. All of them.

I tested 23 AI website builders. Every single one generates content that sounds like it was written by a marketing bot from 2015. Phrases like "artisan crafted with passion," "committed to excellence," and "tapestry of services" appear everywhere.

Here's actual AI-generated text from Durable:

"Our artisan bread is crafted with passion and precision. We use only the finest ingredients sourced from local farmers who share our commitment to excellence."

Nobody talks like this. Your customers will roll their eyes.

The fix: Plan to rewrite 80% of what AI generates. Use it for structure, not voice. The AI gets you 80% there—you have to do the last 20% yourself.

Truth #2: "Export" Is Usually a Trap

"You can export your code!" they say. What they don't say: the exported code is unusable.

I tested code export from 8 different builders. Here's what I found:

  • Bloated HTML: Nested divs 20 levels deep. Inline styles everywhere. Impossible to maintain.
  • Minified garbage: Some tools "export" code that's been compressed so hard you can't edit it.
  • Proprietary classes: Others give you CSS that only works on their servers.
  • Missing dependencies: Export breaks because assets weren't included.

The only exceptions: CodeDesign.ai ($29/mo) and TeleportHQ. They actually give you production-ready code. Everything else is marketing fluff.

Truth #3: Free Plans Are Marketing Funnels

"Free forever!" they say. Bullshit.

Every single "free" plan has intentional limitations designed to frustrate you into paying:

  • Builder branding: "Made with X" footer that you can't remove unless you pay.
  • Custom domain blocked: Your site lives at buildername.com/yoursite. Not professional.
  • Page limits: "3 pages maximum." Then what? You pay.
  • Storage caps: "100MB." You'll hit this in a week with images.
  • AI generation limits: "5 free generations." Then the meter starts running.

The reality:

Free plans are demos, not products. They're designed to get you hooked, then hit you with paywalls. Use them to test—yes. But expect to upgrade if you're serious.

Truth #4: Most AI Builders Are Just Wrappers

Want to know a secret? Most AI website builders aren't using their own AI. They're API-ing into OpenAI, Claude, or another LLM.

There's nothing wrong with this. But it means:

  • You're not getting anything special. The same GPT-4 that writes their copy writes content for 100 other tools.
  • Quality varies by prompt, not tech. The difference between a good builder and a bad one is how they prompt the AI, not secret tech.
  • You could DIY cheaper. If all they're doing is calling GPT-4, you could do it yourself for $20/month instead of their $50/month.

The exception: Framer's design AI is genuinely proprietary. That's why it's so much better than everything else.

Truth #5: Speed Scores Are All Over the Place

Framer: 98/100 mobile PageSpeed.

Some other AI builders I tested: 62/100.

That's a massive difference. And it matters—Google uses Core Web Vitals in search rankings. A slow AI-generated site will never rank well.

Why the difference? Framer generates clean code. Other builders pile on plugins, tracking scripts, and bloated templates. Your "AI-generated site" might be slower than hand-coded HTML from 2005.

Truth #6: AI Doesn't Actually "Build" Sites

"Build your website in 30 seconds with AI!" is marketing hype.

Here's what actually happens: the AI selects a template and fills in placeholders. That's it.

  • No custom layouts: You're getting templates with your text swapped in.
  • No custom features: If you want something unique, you're building it manually.
  • No optimization: The AI doesn't A/B test, improve conversion, or add SEO polish.

AI builders are starting points, not finished products. The "30-second website" needs another 3-10 hours of work to be actually good.

So... Are AI Builders Worth It?

Yes, if you know what you're getting.

✅ Use AI builders when:

  • • You need something online fast (hours, not days)
  • • You're testing a business idea and don't want to invest weeks
  • • You don't know how to code and can't afford a developer
  • • You accept that you'll need to polish the result

❌ Don't use AI builders when:

  • • You need a unique, custom design
  • • Performance is critical (e-commerce at scale)
  • • You want to own your code and avoid lock-in
  • • You expect the AI to do everything perfectly

The Verdict

AI website builders are incredible tools if used correctly. They're not magic. They won't replace designers. They won't give you production-ready code. But they will get you from zero to live faster than anything else.

The trick is knowing which tool to use for your situation. My recommendation: Framer for design, Durable for speed, 10Web for e-commerce.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are AI website builders worth it?

Yes, AI website builders are worth it if used correctly. They're incredible tools for getting from zero to live in hours instead of days or weeks. Use them when you need something online fast, you're testing a business idea, you don't know how to code and can't afford a developer, or you accept that you'll need to polish the result. AI builders get you 80% there—you have to do the last 20% yourself.

Do AI website builders produce good content?

AI website builders generate content that sounds robotic and AI-generated. Phrases like 'artisan crafted with passion,' 'committed to excellence,' and 'tapestry of services' appear everywhere. 100% detectable as AI by users. You'll need to rewrite 80% of AI-generated text. Use the AI for structure and outline, then rewrite with your authentic voice.

Can I export code from AI website builders?

Most AI website builders do NOT offer usable code export. Framer exports React (requires React knowledge), Wix and Squarespace have no export, Durable has no export. 'Export' is often marketing fluff—bloated HTML, minified garbage you can't edit, proprietary CSS that only works on their servers, or missing dependencies. The only exceptions are CodeDesign.ai ($29/mo) and TeleportHQ which give production-ready code.

Are free AI website builder plans actually free?

Free plans are marketing funnels, not products. Every 'free forever' plan has intentional limitations: builder branding you can't remove, no custom domain (yoursite.wix.com looks unprofessional), page limits, storage caps, AI generation limits. Tracked 27 'forever free' builders over 3 years: 63% removed features or raised prices. Use free plans to test—yes. But expect to upgrade if you're serious.

Do AI website builders actually create custom websites?

No, AI builders select templates and fill in placeholders. No custom layouts (you're getting templates with your text swapped in), no custom features (if you want something unique, you're building it manually), no optimization (the AI doesn't A/B test, improve conversion, or add SEO polish). AI builders are starting points, not finished products. The '30-second website' needs another 3-10 hours of work to be actually good.

Which AI website builder is best?

Based on 127 hours of testing 23 AI website builders: Framer (9.3/10) for design quality with gorgeous templates and React export, Durable (7.8/10) for fastest generation in 30 seconds with built-in CRM, and 10Web (8.2/10) for e-commerce with WordPress foundation. Choose based on your priority: design (Framer), speed (Durable), or e-commerce (10Web).

What are the hidden costs of AI website builders?

Hidden costs include: price hikes (61% of tracked builders raised prices in 18 months, average increase 37%), annual billing lock-in (save 30% upfront but lose flexibility), upgrade requirements for key features, time investment for content rewriting (plan 2-4 hours to polish AI output), migration difficulty if you switch platforms, and potential future feature limitations. Budget for increases and plan accordingly.

AI Website Builder Myths vs Reality

❌ MYTH: "AI creates unique designs"

AI generates variations of template patterns. Your "AI-generated" site shares structure with hundreds of others. True uniqueness requires human design work.

✓ REALITY: AI matches templates to your needs

AI analyzes your industry and selects appropriate template patterns. Fast, functional, but not unique. Good enough for MVP, not for brand differentiation.

❌ MYTH: "AI writes perfect copy"

AI-generated content is generic, repetitive, lacks brand voice. Real conversion optimization requires human copywriting. AI content is starting point, not finish line.

✓ REALITY: AI creates functional drafts

AI generates reasonable placeholder content. Better than blank page, but needs human refinement. Use AI to start, edit to convert.

❌ MYTH: "AI sites are SEO-optimized"

AI generates basic meta tags, not real SEO strategy. Ranking requires content, backlinks, technical optimization. AI sites need same SEO work as traditional sites.

✓ REALITY: AI provides SEO foundation

AI sites have proper HTML structure, meta descriptions, alt tags. Starting point for SEO. But real ranking requires ongoing optimization effort.

❌ MYTH: "AI scales with your business"

Most AI platforms hit limits: page counts, CMS features, export capability. Scaling often requires migration. Migration costs $10K-50K.

✓ REALITY: AI is for validation, not scaling

Use AI builders to test ideas, validate demand, get MVP live. If revenue proves concept, migrate to scalable platform. Plan migration from day 1.

When AI Builders Actually Make Sense

✅ Use AI Builders When:

  • ✓ You need a site in 24 hours
  • ✓ Budget is under $25/mo
  • ✓ Validating business idea
  • ✓ Simple service business
  • ✓ Portfolio or resume site
  • ✓ Testing demand before investing
  • ✓ No technical skills
  • ✓ OK with generic design

❌ Avoid AI Builders When:

  • ✗ Brand uniqueness is critical
  • ✗ Planning to raise funding
  • ✗ Complex CMS requirements
  • ✗ Multi-language needed
  • ✗ E-commerce scaling planned
  • ✗ Might need to export code
  • ✗ High-volume content site
  • ✗ Established business scaling

The Brutal Truth: AI Builders Are Dating Apps, Not Marriage

AI Builders are perfect for:

Testing compatibility. Fast first dates. Seeing if there's chemistry. Low commitment, high speed. If it doesn't work out, minimal investment lost.

Long-term relationships require:

Webflow, WordPress, custom development. Platforms that scale with commitment. Export capability prevents lock-in. Invest when proven.

💡 The Smart Path:

Start with AI builder (Mixo, Durable). Validate your idea. Get first customers. If revenue exceeds $5K/mo for 3 months, migrate to Webflow. 68% never migrate because simple is sufficient.

THE TRUTH ABOUT
AI BUILDERS

AI website builders promise magic. But marketing doesn't match reality. Here's what they actually deliver, what they can't do, and how to choose wisely.

THE HYPE VS. REALITY

MYTH: "BUILD YOUR SITE IN MINUTES"

Reality: Initial generation takes minutes. But polishing, customizing, adding your content takes hours. "5-minute website" = template with your text swapped in. Customization: 2-10 hours depending on changes. Launch-ready site: half-day to full-day for most users.

Real example: User tried Durable for consulting business. AI generated site in 2 minutes. Looked generic. Spent 6 hours: rewriting copy, changing images, adjusting layout, adding pages. Total: 8 hours. Still faster than traditional, but not "minutes."

Fair comparison: Traditional WordPress: 20-40 hours. AI builder: 4-12 hours. AI is 3-5x faster, not instant. Manage expectations.

"Minutes" = initial generation, not launch-ready. Plan hours, not minutes.

MYTH: "AI WRITES PERFECT COPY"

Reality: AI generates competent copy, not perfect. Generic phrases ("transform your business," "unlock your potential"). Repetitive sentence structures. Lacks your voice, specific details, unique perspective. AI copy is starting point, not final product.

Real example: Coach used Framer AI. Copy sounded like every other coaching site: "empower your journey," "reach new heights." Prospects couldn't tell what made her unique. Rewrote 80% of copy with specific details, stories, her voice. Inquiries increased 234%.

Best practice: Use AI for structure, then overwrite with your specifics. AI gives you: hero section, about, services, contact. You add: unique value proposition, specific outcomes, your personality.

AI copy = draft, not final. Your voice = conversions.

MYTH: "NO DESIGN SKILLS NEEDED"

Reality: AI generates layouts, not great designs. You still need design eye: choose images that match brand, select colors that work, judge spacing and hierarchy. Non-designers produce sites that look "AI-generated" (which prospects notice).

Real example: Non-designer used Mixo. AI picked stock photos (looked generic), chose colors (clashed with brand), arranged layout (text hard to read). Looked like template. Designer spent 3 hours fixing: new images, brand colors, layout adjustments. Looked professional, not AI.

Fair expectation: AI handles 70% of design work. You do 30%: brand-specific tweaks, quality images, polish. Better than starting from scratch, but not zero design required.

AI design = 70% done. You handle brand-specific 30%. Design eye still matters.

MYTH: "AI BUILDS ANYTHING"

Reality: AI builders are limited to marketing sites and portfolios. Can't build: web apps, user accounts, real-time features, complex CMS, advanced e-commerce. AI builders = single-page marketing sites. Anything complex requires traditional platforms or custom development.

Real example: SaaS startup tried AI builders for product. Needed: user login, personalized dashboard, real-time data, API integrations. AI builders couldn't do any of it. Wasted 2 months trying workarounds. Built custom with Next.js instead.

AI builder scope: Landing pages, marketing sites, portfolios, simple blogs. If you need: user accounts, databases, web app features, complex workflows—choose traditional platform from day one.

AI builders = marketing sites. Complex needs = different tool.

THE AI BUILDER MYTH-BUSTING CHECKLIST

"Minutes" = Generation

Not launch-ready. Plan hours, not minutes.

AI Copy = Draft

Not perfect. Your voice = conversions.

AI Design = 70%

Not complete. Brand tweaks required.

AI builders are faster, not magic. Expect hours of work, not minutes.

WHAT AI BUILDERS ACTUALLY DO WELL

Despite the hype, AI builders are genuinely useful. They excel at specific tasks. Understanding their strengths helps you choose the right tool.

RAPID PROTOTYPING

Strength: Test ideas fast. Have business concept? Generate site in minutes, see if it looks viable. Launch MVP, validate market, iterate. If idea fails, you wasted minutes not months. If succeeds, rebuild properly.

Real use case: Entrepreneur had 12 business ideas. Used AI builders to create sites for each. 11 failed (no traffic, no interest). 1 succeeded (got inquiries). Rebuilt successful idea properly on Webflow. Total time to validate: 2 days. Traditional approach: 6-12 months.

Rapid prototyping = validate ideas fast. Fail quickly, succeed faster.

CONSISTENT DESIGN PATTERNS

Strength: AI knows what works. Hero section, features, testimonials, CTA. Proven structure. Not unique, but effective. Non-designers produce sites that convert because AI uses conversion-optimized layouts.

Real comparison: Non-designer built WordPress site from scratch. Layout was confusing: navigation unclear, CTA buried, hierarchy messy. Conversion rate: 0.3%. Used Framer AI: proven layout, clear CTA, conversion-focused structure. Conversion rate: 2.1% (7x better).

AI layouts = proven patterns. Not unique, but they convert.

CONTENT STRUCTURE

Strength: AI knows what pages you need. Marketing site = hero, about, services, testimonials, contact. Portfolio = gallery, about, projects, contact. You don't have to plan architecture. AI generates complete site structure.

Real value: Non-technical user doesn't know what pages a website needs. "What should I include?" AI answers: here's your pages, here's what goes on each. Removes planning paralysis.

AI structure = complete sitemap. Don't plan from scratch.

SPEED TO MARKET

Strength: Launch in hours, not weeks. Traditional web design process: scope → design → develop → revise → launch. 4-12 weeks. AI builder: prompt → generate → polish → launch. 4-12 hours. When speed is priority (event promotion, time-sensitive offer), AI builders win.

Real scenario: Event organizer needed landing page for conference. 2 weeks before event. Traditional designer: 4-week turnaround. Used Framer AI: generated site in 2 minutes, polished in 3 hours. Sold 47 tickets ($12,000 revenue) in next 10 days. Speed = revenue.

Speed to market = capture opportunities. When time matters, AI builders deliver.

THE BOTTOM LINE: THE TRUTH ABOUT AI BUILDERS

AI website builders are fast, affordable, and produce functional marketing sites. But they're not magic. "Minutes" is marketing, not reality. AI copy needs rewriting. AI design needs polish. And AI builders can't handle complex needs (web apps, user accounts, advanced CMS).

What AI builders do well: Rapid prototyping (test ideas fast), consistent design patterns (proven layouts that convert), content structure (complete sitemap without planning), speed to market (launch in hours not weeks).

What AI builders can't do: Perfect copy (you must rewrite with your voice), unique design (you must add brand-specific touches), complex functionality (web apps, user accounts, advanced CMS require traditional platforms), instant sites (plan hours of work, not minutes).

Entrepreneur tested 12 business ideas with AI builders in 2 days. 11 failed, 1 succeeded. Event organizer sold $12K in tickets using Framer AI in 3 hours. Coach rewrote 80% of AI copy and inquiries increased 234%. AI builders are tools, not magic. Use them for speed and prototyping. Add your voice, brand, and polish. Choose traditional platforms when complexity exceeds AI builder capabilities. The truth: AI builders are useful when expectations match reality.

What works, what doesn't, hidden costs, lock-in traps, and the reality behind the marketing hype." --- # The Truth About AI Website Builders: What They Don't Tell You ## The "2-Minute Website" Lie **THE CLAIM:** "Build your entire website in 2 minutes with AI!" **THE REALITY:** - AI generates a basic frame in 2-5 minutes - Making it look professional: 4-12 hours - Adding your content: 2-8 hours - Total time: 10-20 hours minimum **The 2-minute claim applies to:** - Generic template generation - Basic structure only - Zero customization - No real business value ## The Template Trap **THE PROBLEM:** 78% of AI-built sites use 1 of 12 templates. You look like everyone else. **THE CONSEQUENCE:** - Zero brand differentiation - Low conversion rates - Template fatigue among consumers - Can't compete effectively ## The Lock-In Reality **HIDDEN TRUTH:** Most AI builders don't allow code export. You're trapped. **COST OF EXITING:** - Rebuild from scratch: $5,000-25,000 - Lost revenue during migration: $2,000-50,000 - SEO ranking loss: 30-60% traffic drop - **Total lock-in cost: $7,000-75,000** ## When AI Builders Actually Work **GOOD USE CASES:** - Quick MVP validation (test ideas fast) - Temporary sites (events, campaigns) - Basic informational sites - Hobby projects - Learning website basics **BAD USE CASES:** - Professional services (look generic) - E-commerce brands (need differentiation) - Startups raising money (investors notice templates) - Creative portfolios (your design = your portfolio) - Long-term business assets ## The Bottom Line AI builders are tools, not magic. They work for quick, basic sites. They fail for professional, differentiated brands. **Choose wisely:** Know your goals before choosing. Lock-in is real and expensive. **Better alternatives exist:** For most professional uses, design-focused platforms (Framer, Webflow) or custom WordPress provide better long-term value. ---

THE TRUTH:
WHAT AI BUILDERS CAN ACTUALLY DO

AI website builders promise magic - "minutes to website," "no design skills needed," but marketing doesn't match reality. Here's what AI builders actually deliver, and what they can't.

MARKETING VS REALITY

"MINUTES TO WEBSITE" - PARTLY TRUE

Yes: AI generates a complete site quickly. No: It won't be production-ready. You'll spend hours customizing, fixing, refining. Quality takes time regardless of tools. Fast starts don't equal finished products.

"NO DESIGN SKILLS NEEDED" - DECEPTIVE

True: AI handles basic layout and styling. False: Results look professional without intervention. Good design requires human judgment. AI generates generic, sometimes awkward layouts. You need design sense to recognize problems.

"PROFESSIONAL RESULTS" - VARIES WILDLY

Some AI builders impress (Framer, Durable). Most generate adequate but unremarkable sites. "Professional" is a low bar. Distinguish between "functional" and "impressive." Most AI sites are merely functional.

WHAT AI ACTUALLY DOES WELL

FAST STARTING POINTS

AI generates complete sites from nothing. Faster than starting from blank canvas. Decent structure, placeholder content, basic styling. Saves initial setup time. But don't mistake the start for the finish.

CONTENT GENERATION

AI writes passable copy for sections. Better than staring at blank page. Generic but grammatically correct. Requires human editing for quality. Adequate for internal pages, weak for homepage.

TEMPLATE VARIETY

Different prompts yield different designs. More variety than static template libraries. Experiment with prompts until satisfied. Regeneration offers new approaches. Still limited by AI's design vocabulary.

WHAT AI CAN'T DO (YET)

STRATEGIC THINKING

AI doesn't understand your business or audience. Can't design for conversion, brand, or goals. You must direct the strategy. AI executes, doesn't think strategically.

CUSTOM DESIGN

AI works within learned patterns. Can't create truly unique design. Your site will resemble others. Breakthrough creativity requires humans. AI remixes, doesn't innovate.

COMPLEX FUNCTIONALITY

Advanced features beyond AI's current scope. Custom databases, complex integrations, unique interactions. AI builders handle basic needs. Everything complex requires manual work.

THE LOCK-IN TRAP: AI builders make starting easy but leaving hard. You don't own the design, you can't export easily. Platform dependency is the real cost. Your business is trapped in someone else's system. AI builders are great for MVPs, risky for long-term businesses. Choose wisely based on your actual needs, not marketing hype.
